mods.note: 3 : For instance, in the province of Dhahireli the Chief of the Beni Ghafir is styled Temimet-el-Ghafiriyeh, and looked upon as a sort of referee in matters affecting the the general interests of the Ghafiris. The Hinawis of ‘ Oman have been usually accustomed to respect the reign ing Seyyid of the Al-bu-Sa‘eed as their Temimet. The above remarks are intended to supplement a table which has been pre pared of the principal tribes; perhaps they may also help to elucidate the some what complicated question of the growth and mutual relations of the rival parties in the state of ‘ Oman.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: The table is signed by Edward Charles Ross, Political Agent at Muscat. The table is divided between the Hinawi and Ghafiri divisions and contains information in columns headed Names of Tribes. Adjective Form; Name of Tribes. Collective Plural Form; Religious Sect; Province; Villages or Districts; Number of Males; and Remarks.The Arabic content of this item is confined to letters of the Arabic alphabet appearing in the key to pronunciation and transliteration on folio 4.The date is supplied by the date of the volume as a whole.
